intro: Astronidium palauense, commonly known as the Palau starfruit tree, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Palau in the western Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit, resembling a starfruit, is edible and has a tangy, slightly sweet flavor. The plant is adapted to coastal and lowland habitats, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
